intro: Henslowia wrayi, commonly known as the Wray's henslowia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms during the late spring and early summer months. Henslowia wrayi thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, woodland environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
